Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root() → dict¶

Root endpoint for the FastAPI application.

Returns:

A welcome message.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup() → None¶

Initialize the FastAPI application on startup.

This function sets up the Redis connection for rate limiting.

REST API repository Contacts¶

src.repository.contacts.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, owner_id: int) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the contact to create.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

The newly created note.

Return type:

Contact

src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, owner_id: int) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

Deleted contact or or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact|None

src.repository.contacts.get_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, owner_id: int) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the contact_id for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • owner_id (int) – The owner_id to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified contact_id, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

contact | None

src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, owner_id: int, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100) → list[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific owner_id with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the owner of the contacts.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, owner_id: int) → list[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next week for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session, query: str, owner_id: int) → list[Contact]¶

Search a contact by query for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • query (str) – The search query to filter contacts.

  • owner_id (int) – The owner_id to retrieve the contact for.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search query.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.repository.contacts.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, owner_id: int) → Contact | None¶

Updates a contact for a specific owner_id.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The data for the contact to create.

  • owner_id (int) – The ID of the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

Updated contact or or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact|None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Marks the user’s email as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶
async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the user’s avatar URL in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user whose avatar is to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL to set.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the updated avatar.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the user’s refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token to set, or None to clear it.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

REST API routes Contacts¶

src.routes.contacts.create_new_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

src.routes.contacts.delete_existing_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Delete a contact by its ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

Contact

src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_with_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.routes.contacts.read_all_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts for the current user.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.routes.contacts.read_single_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Retrieve a single contact by its ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

Contact

src.routes.contacts.search_contacts_by_query(query: str = Query(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → List[Contact]¶

Search for contacts by a query string for the current user.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search query string.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search query.

Return type:

List[Contact]

src.routes.contacts.update_existing_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

Update an existing contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – The updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → UserDb¶

Retrieve the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The current user’s information.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserDb¶

Update the current user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The new avatar file to upload.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user information with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Confirm user’s email using a token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token sent to the user’s email for confirmation.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or if the user does not exist.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the email confirmation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

User login endpoint.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2 password request form containing username and password.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist, email is not confirmed, or password is invalid.

Returns:

A response containing access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

Refresh access token endpoint.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTP authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or does not match the user’s stored token.

Returns:

A response containing a new access token and refresh token.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

Request email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – RequestEmail object containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending email.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist or if the email is already confirmed.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the email request.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → UserResponse¶

User registration endpoint.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User data for registration.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending email.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user already exists or if there is an error during registration.

Returns:

A response containing the newly created user and a success message.

Return type:

UserResponse
